website_summaries.verdict: In spite of a few known issues, this Schwinn has the most to offer on our list when it comes to features and a comfortable, versatile ride.
pros: Offers a comfortable ride thanks to the swept-back handlebars, 28-inch wheels, and padded seat
Aluminum frame and 21 speeds make it ideal for casual riding or zipping around town
cons: Shorter ladies may find it a bit too high off the ground for adequate control
Occasional brake and gear adjustments may be needed and can be challenging for those without bike repair knowledge
Spokes have been known to break

customer_reviews.title: I am very petite and i love this bike.
customer_reviews.text: perfect and i am 4 feel 11 inches! Cannot believe i can ride this 29inch wheel bike, awesome
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: With a price tag of $280, I would expect quality! That is not the case here. Front Deraileur does not have enough travel to switch to all 3 sprockets. Furthermore, there is excessive run out in the Rear Wheel Spindle. This causes the Sprocket set to wobble as the spindle rotates. Very poor quality. Mr. Schwinn would roll in his grave if he knew that his company moved its production to China and let the quality decrease to this point!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hill

customer_reviews.title: Screwed Up.
customer_reviews.text: Screws where the water bottle mount would go are in the wrong place. The screws are in the under carriage. It should be on top of the middle frame bar. I saw pictures. No water bottle for this bike. Too expensive and large to send back. Plus I paid 90.00 to have the bike assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Crystal Harper

customer_reviews.title: As good as they say.
customer_reviews.text: A beautifully made bike. Welds that remind of the brazing on my 60s era Raleigh Sports 3 speed. As a "hybrid," whatever that means, it comes with a fairly flat handlebar that brings your torso forward and puts your wrists at a rather awkward angle. Wrists tire quickly on this 70ish author. Consider replacing the handlebar with something like the "Sunlite Northroad Touring Handlebar," available at a real reasonable price here on Amazon. (Non compensated recommendation.) All the other 5 star reviews are accurate. No need to go into all the positives here.
customer_reviews.author: The Green-Piper

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn makes a good bike.
customer_reviews.text: I've been riding this bike for almost 6 months. I love this thing. the gears are pretty smooth shifting, the brakes work and grip quick and tight! the ride is cushy up front, the rear is pretty giving and the seat helps take a lot of the impact away. I left the fenders on and they look kinda 70's or 80's, but ride through puddles and you'll be glad they're on! The storage rack on the back is a very nice accessory to have! The handle bars are adjustable enough to make a comfortable ride for any size body stature. I'm glad I went with a Schwinn.
customer_reviews.author: EricF

customer_reviews.title: Missing assembly guide
customer_reviews.text: Shipment did not include a user manual or an assembly guide. I tried to assemble the handle bar and the pedals by myself however there are other parts of the bike that requires me to look at the user guide in order to proceed further. It’s disappointing to not see a user manual in the package.I do see some Oily stuff around most of the nuts and bolts. I will have to reach out to the seller to see if they can send me a digital copy of the user manual to make it easier
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: The front splash guard is a manufacturing joke
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 versions of this bike now that the first one was stolen off the porch. The splash guard parts aren't built to fit properly. I had it working jury-rigged temporarily through 6 washers and the bolt, but that kind of jury-rigging doesn't stand up to vibrations. If they would just build the parts to fit together...
customer_reviews.author: rmbmx

customer_reviews.title: Front derail dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I assemble everything together, then the last part, the gear shifts. I got the rear one to work correctly, but the front one won't shift. Okay, so maybe the mechanics at the bike shop can figure something out that I couldn't... come to find out they told me I need a new front derail altogether. It's a new bike... it's the principle of it... I shouldn't have to buy parts to get it to work correctly. No I'm not going through the hassle of the warranty for this. I'm better off raising my budget for a better built bike.
customer_reviews.author: HNP

customer_reviews.title: Can't sit upright
customer_reviews.text: This bike is well made and it looks lovely. However, because I have to lean forward and bend down to reach the handlebars, and the fact that the wheels are very thin, I ended up sending it back for a refund. In the picture it looks like one can sit upright and ride, but that's not the case, at least for me. I'm 5'3", and nearly 60yrs old. Not a comfortable position.
customer_reviews.author: Patti in California

customer_reviews.title: Light aluminum frame? Come again?
customer_reviews.text: This bike is extremely heavy...! It's supposed to be made of aluminum but I am very suspicious about the claim. Not enough spokes and I do know that I will have to change the tires just by looking at it. Not worth buying this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Darnel

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Bike!
customer_reviews.text: I look forward to getting on this bike and it makes me happy! I'm a woman, 5'4", 120 lbs, 60, and a life-long athlete. I'm riding on roads, mostly for fitness and fun-1-2 hour rides. I have a Schwinn La Tour that I refurbished, but with only 12 speeds, it was too hard getting up steep hills. This bike is a great improvement. I surprised myself buying a bike online sight unseen, but this bike is very good quality for the price, and I like the classic look. I played around with the seat height and handlebar angle quite a bit, until I found the sweet spot. Go for it; it think you'll enjoy the ride!
customer_reviews.author: Teach English

customer_reviews.title: Have both the girls and boys bike they are worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: We bought our in 2012, we have taken them for tune ups at the local bike shop which actually sells the Schwinn bikes. Extremely happy with the bikes, the only thing I can say is thankfully we bought them when we did, the price is now triple what we paid. We also have the bike trailers for our little fur babies to go to the dog park. They came early in the day since they were mostly assembled and the FedEX driver wanted to make room in his van. Would recommend these to anyone looking for a great bike.
customer_reviews.author: AFORCE

customer_reviews.title: Be careful about size. This bike is not for short individuals and seller will not allow a return.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful about size. This bike is not for short individuals and seller will not allow a return. I purchased the 16" frame which is listed as the small size. There is no way I can ride this safely. The seller took several days to "review" my request and did not allow a return. This would have been avoided if they had posted a size chart in the description. I also had difficulty adjusting the front brakes. The booklet provided was not clear.
customer_reviews.author: Spring

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Bike
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this bike to be able to go riding everyday. I works wonderful. Put to9gether fairly easy. Needed to reread some parts of instruction manual to make sure I understood what to do. But this bike rides great. Nice Smooth Ride. Shifts cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Andy W

customer_reviews.title: Parts problems
customer_reviews.text: I really like the bike, now that it’s been taken to a bike shop to address the issues it came with. First, the manual that came with the bike was not for the correct bike. Whatever, I can still put it together. The front brake cable crimp was completely missing and one of the wires had began to come off. The front fender arm was bent and the hardware incorrect to install it. The derailleur needed significant adjustments. It was just more simple to take the bike to the bike shop to get it properly operational as opposed to disassembling it and shipping it back. I’d recommend installing a wider seat.
customer_reviews.author: flyinghigh

customer_reviews.title: Great for riding on designated bike trails
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband so he could start riding outside since he doesn't like the cycling class at the gym. He just wants to be able to ride around in parks where they have paved bicycle trails or in the neighborhood. He doesn't commute, put it together himself and said it's comfortable. Height 5' 6" about 200#. Wants to use it for extra exercise instead of going to the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Anniemac

customer_reviews.title: Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a discounted bike because it was A return with a damaged box. I was a little nervous but everything turned out to be perfect. Assembly was a breeze and the ride is smooth. I am 5’4” - female and the fit Is great!
customer_reviews.author: Adeel Baig

customer_reviews.title: Front tire issues.
customer_reviews.text: The bearings in the front tire tore the washer (or whatever it's called) apart on the first use and now the bike is unusable without a replacement tire.
customer_reviews.author: Halo

customer_reviews.title: I've had it in my garage and it's rusted already
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good value for the money. It's cheap, the wheel covers are cheap plastic, the handlebars are rusted, the gear slips if pedaling too fast not a $400+ bike other than the style is cute.
customer_reviews.author: Mram1

customer_reviews.title: Great All Around Bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this (and the white one) for riding around the city. Have taken them to dirt trails and they performed great. (I'm not talking about mountain biking, mind you.) The front shock works nice. The gears shift smoothly - after a bit of adjustment, which isn't unexpected. They're comfortable. Nice ride. Lifetime warranty. I don't think you can beat them for the price.
customer_reviews.author: John Morris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The derailleur is cheap and makes this bike useless. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Magallon

customer_reviews.title: This bike is OK.
customer_reviews.text: I had this bike for a year now. I love the style and I think it makes a good commuter bike but it weights a lot, which makes it difficult to bring it up to the apartment unless you have a big enough elevator. I've also had to take it in to the bike shop so many times at this point. So at last, I'm not sure that it's the best purchase. You can get a lighter bike for about the same price, if not less, with hopefully less problems.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Giza

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike!
customer_reviews.text: The front brakes were difficult to assemble, but after two hours of "figuring" it out, I have a new bike. I can go up hills without standing and the seat is perfect for long treks. Throw a bag on the carrier and you can go for miles. Great overall bike for the cost, but I wish it came with the headlamp and better brake assembly instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, but not great quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking bike, however it has some major flaws... the bike front derailleur is terrible...even with multiple tweaks it won’t move chain to lowest setting - more adjustments and it then won’t go to highest. Overall really poor. The brakes are low quality - they work, but also require tweaking to avoid squeaky and rubbing tires. With some love it can be a good bike, but advise replacing the front derailleur right away.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  Viola

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Contrary to some, this is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.text: I've read some bad news about delivery of this and similar bikes. I also read about how difficult it is for some people to assemble. None of these negative reviews applied to me. Easy to assemble, not damaged in shipment, AND! it is a perfect fit for me. Rides like a charm. This is my first hybrid bike, a tenth of the cost of my road bike. I've only put 162 miles on it so far. I am looking forward to more miles.
customer_reviews.author: Wally Woo

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bike! I use it to get to class and it is a very comfortable ride. I am 5'4" and I find it to be a very comfortable height. My only issue is the tires need to be pumped up every time I use it, which is a couple times a week, and this seems excessive.
customer_reviews.author: Caitie

customer_reviews.title: Well built commuter, get a better seat.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike but get a better seat. It's well built and assembles easily but listen to the reviews that tell you to get a better seat. The seat looks nice and seems comfortable until you use the bike for more than a few minutes. Aside from that I'm gladnI bought it and would recommend this bike to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Good bikes, but...
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these Schwinn bikes. One for me and one for my husband (men's version). They are good bikes for the money; however, there have been a number of issues with them that, because my husband is very good with bike repair, he was able to fix. I would not recommend these bikes to someone who is just looking for a bike to pop out of the box and use. The gears and brakes have needed numerous adjustments, and one of the tires had the wrong size tube in it. They are reasonably priced for what they are, but be prepared to work on them.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne McDade

customer_reviews.title: I love the bicycle
customer_reviews.text: I love the bicycle, but the assembly instructions were lacking. Specifically, they never mentioned the front fender even though you need to add it, and my handlebar stem was disassembled in a completely different way than the instructions expected. The info on tuning the brakes was good, but I had to YouTube the derailleur adjustments to understand what the directions were saying and which were the screws I was supposed to be adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Faulty pieces
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when I saw this bike was finally back in stock, but when I took it to get assembled, I was told there were faulty pieces on the final steps so it could not be fully put together. I can’t figure out how to return a half-assembled bike! This is a huge problem for me because I needed a bike for starting college and now I’m out a ton of money without a bike right before school! Maybe I just got a faulty bike but be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the city!
customer_reviews.text: I love my bike so much, and apparently other people do too, because people keep attempting to steal it from me. (Invest in a good bike lock!) I have noticed that my handlebars have to be tightened pretty often on this bike. I am not sure if it is a problem with the handlebars, the screws, or with the way I put it together. I am a 5ft 8 female, and feel very comfortable riding this bike. I take it on paved roads and sidewalks often. This bike is perfect for the price, and perfect for living in the city.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Hammontree

customer_reviews.title: First impression is great
customer_reviews.text: Despite the fact that a bolt for the front wheel wing has been lost during delivery (I found a replacement under the frame), the first impression is still great. I bought the bike for my wife and it looks amazing! I assembled it by my own. Taking into account that I have never done this before, it took some time to understand how to attach the wheel and the wing properly, but eventually it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful easy riding bike.
customer_reviews.text: This bike has a great smooth ride. Only issue is the super hard seat...Pricey bike to have to replace the seat, but I absolutely had to.
customer_reviews.author: PRAISE LADY

customer_reviews.title: Quality bike, but had to replace both tubes
customer_reviews.text: I am a 6'3", 220 # man, I bought this bike for casual use and an occasional workout. After airing up the tires (65#), before i even sat on the bike, the tube in the rear tire popped. I replaced the rear tube and took the bike on my first ride and got 1.75 miles away from my house and the front tire popped. I have now replaced both tubes and have biked 18 miles on this bike. Other than having to replace the tubes in both tires, the bike seems to be a good quality for the money. Just extremely frustrating having to put money into a new bike before you can even ride it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Assembly extremely difficult because parts came misasembled
customer_reviews.text: The bike looks gorgeous but Lord Jesus I should have bought it in store . We had to reassemble the bike , because it came partially assembled ....WRONG. The spokes are making the wheels wobble, and I had to go get it fixed at a bike shop . Thanks for making me spend more unecessary money for an already expensive bike .s
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for price fixing by some current sellers.
customer_reviews.text: Good bike for the price I paid, but some current sellers are taking advantage of bike shortage to sell for much more than its worth.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money through Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this bike. Taken it on several rides already and performs as I expected. Very smooth and wasn’t to bad to assemble. Bought it through Amazon so was very happy with the price, I have seen other sellers offering at a much higher price, not sure I would spend the higher prices for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love My Commuter!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking at getting into commuting back and forth to work via bicycle. I spent hours and days reviewing many bikes. I finally came to this one and I'm very happy I did all the research because this bike has been perfect for me. My path includes a pavement trail and some dirt. The bike handles both terrains perfectly. I tow a pet trailer sometimes to take dogs to the park. Again, handles smoothly. This bike is strong and fun... I'm 38 but the kid comes out of me very often. Completely recommend... And the seat is comfy too.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely packed in the box. Easy to assemble. Directions were straightforward and simple to follow. The gears shift smoothly and the ride is comfortable especially with the extra padding on the seat. Quick release adjustment on the seat height, and a quick release for the front wheel if you need to put in in your trunk. The luggage rack has a spring clamp which makes carrying small items easy. The only issue I had so far was with the fenders. Plastic and seem to get just a little twisted if leaned up against, say a tree or a wall. Just pull them, unbend them, whatever and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: The bike was very good for the first day I decided to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: The bike was very good for the first day I decided to use it outside. It was stolen a few hours later. do not buy with the rope chain that is recommended to buy it with. I watched the guy on a camera cut it within seconds. that's my error. Other than that, the bike was very comfortable. built in rack was wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Wright Path Technologies

customer_reviews.title: Good beginners bike
customer_reviews.text: Good beginners bike. I have gone close to a thousand or so miles and it has held up well so far. This is a good all purpose bike and is comfortable for long distances. It isn't too flashy and has a good build quality. The only drawback of this bike is the weight and a lose bolt in the steering rack which has to be tightened every 10 miles or so.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Love the bike so far - very comfortable and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the bike so far - very comfortable and the gears change smoothly. However, the first delivery came in a damaged box which obviously was laid flat against the warning printed on the box. The front wheel was bent, but Amazon quickly sent a new bike and we only needed to replace the bent wheel. We were worried it would be difficult to assemble, but it was mostly assembled so we had no problems outside of the damaged wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beauty
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. Bike came partially assembled and took about 30 mins. to assemble. Anyone that has owned a bike should be able to assemble this. The bike is a real beauty.The bike needed no adjustments for brakes or gears. The front wheel had a warp spot that took a few minutes to correct. ( used U-tube for instruction). I am 5'11 and 190#. Bike fits me well. I look forward to many years of riding.
customer_reviews.author: Reba Mller

customer_reviews.title: The assembly was pretty easy and it rides really nice
customer_reviews.text: The assembly was pretty easy and it rides really nice. My wife thought it was a tad bit too big for her though. She is 5'4". But she can still ride it with ease. She just has to tip toe a bit when the bike is at rest. We did replace the seat to a more comfortable one. She felt like it was too hard and small. She likes to ride this bike to cruise around just to get a little bit of exercise everyday. We have mounted a box at the back for our dog to ride along!
customer_reviews.author: dadof2

customer_reviews.title: low quality schwinn discover hybrid bicycle
customer_reviews.text: 1) the front break snapped while assembling 2) the front fender does not fit, according to the instructions of the manual, 3) The manual is generic and need specific instructions for the bike one buys, 4) left bad taste on the first purchase
customer_reviews.author: Krishna kamasamudram

customer_reviews.title: 2 spoke wheel pattern may cause issues.
customer_reviews.text: It was difficult to true the wheels and the professional installer said the 2 spoke pattern of these bikes look sharp, but make it very difficult and sometimes impossible to get the wheels totally straight since there are large gaps between spokes where there is no ability to make the wheels straight. Wheels were warped from factory. Bike looks sharp once put together but will see how it holds up, and if 2 spoke pattern causes premature spoke breakage.
customer_reviews.author: theDyker

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BIKE, PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'10" and I was worried I would be too tall for this bike-I am not! The bike feels so great! The ride is smooth and the controls are easy to use. It's a hybrid and I tried it on trails and road--awesome on both! My friend had a trail bike and when we went on the trails, she was direclty behind me, she got a flat tire and I did not! I DID spend an additional $70 to have it assembled at a bike shop because several people told me it was dangerous to try to assemble it yourself (particularly the brakes)
customer_reviews.author: Discount On Me

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Been riding this bike for about a week or so with my dog, and it's great! Best features: - Works with Solvit Tagalong Pet Bicycle Basket - Very comfortable ride; your feet can almost touch the ground, it has a low step-over, and the handle bars are shaped for your hands and curve backwards. - Comes with a rear bike rack - Has a kickstand. YES! The only complaints I have are: - One of the brake pads was crooked so that had to be replaced ($5 from the bike shop) - The plastic wheel guards (keeps water and mud out) is crooked so sometimes it rubs against the wheel - The left hand grip feels slightly crooked
customer_reviews.author: nabit

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfect bike for tooling around and commuting
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect bike for tooling around and commuting. Comfortable, shifts great, looks good. For those looking for a bike that a bike-trailer can easily attach to: This is not the one. This bike's rear-wheel does Not have a quick release and because of the mudflap, the standard bike-trailer attachment does Not fit due to the mudflap nut/bolt. Luckily, a friend was able to take off the mudflap bolt and tie the piece that would attach to the bolt to the bolt whole and then there was enough room for the bike-trailer attachment. If I would have known this, I would not have bought this bike. But, luckily, the fix worked and it really is a nice bike.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: I didn't really realize it was bigger than 26 inch and a little big for my daughter, but she loves it. It's good quality for a what's become "department store" bike brand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Drumm

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the same Schwinn model I purchased about 7 years ago that was stolen. The old bike was great no problems in all those years and the new one worked right out of the box. I had a bike shop assemble it. Great bike.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Payne

customer_reviews.title: Decent bike for the price. Shifts smoothly after adjusting ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent bike for the price. Shifts smoothly after adjusting everything, did not shift smoothly out of the box. A small amount of knowledge is helpful. Youtube is there if you don't have that knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: S. Neal

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, but parts missing
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. Solid ride so far - My only complaint is that it came missing a couple nuts and screws and I tried contacting the company and didn't get any reply. That bummed me out because the parts missing are designed for the bike and I've had a hard time finding ones to fit perfectly so the parts I substituted were a little loose. Mine was probably a fluke, but definitely try to get in touch with a rep before purchasing so you have a contact in case something is missing.
customer_reviews.author: okboomer

customer_reviews.title: good value for an excellent around town bike
customer_reviews.text: Had bike assembled at local bike shop. Lightweight rides nice with shocks and the 21 speeds. Storage rack and kick stand included where some bikes you have to buy separate. Also, screw holes for air pump and water bottle holder on main frame. Only complaint is the handlebars do not adjust up or down. I will be buying a $40 dollar part that will allow for a 4 inch adjustment on the handlebar. Overall very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my daily ride bike!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my bike for a year now, amd I ride it 5 miles every day! The brakes were set wrong when it arrived, so I needed an bike mechanic to fix that, but otherwise I have no complaints! I absolutely love this bike. The seat gets uncomfortable by the end of the ride, so I am going to get a gel seat cover. But I couldn't be happier! The hear system is very nice, and I love using the minor +/- hear shift.
customer_reviews.author: reverie626

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing bicycle, I love it. It's so well built my future grandchildren will probably still use it
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing bicycle, I love it. It's so well built my future grandchildren will probably still use it. This is a nice riding bicycle, it's heavy but not a problem, when I'm going uphill at all.I haven't owned a bike in over 30yrs. I just hopped on and felt like a kid again. The wider tires really grip the road and no problem with dirt. I ride it to the store all the time. I ditched the car. I can't wait to ride it to the library.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn ladies bike
customer_reviews.text: I just love my new bike. It was very large for my 5'4 height when I first got it. After my husband put it together and it still did not feel right; I took it to my local bike store and they serviced it for me, corrected everything that needed tweeking, adjusted the seat, gears and brakes. Now I am a bike queen. love love love the bike. I have been riding for fitness almost every day since I got the bike. Its smooth and I feel like this is something I will stick too. Getting a work out never felt better. 53 and loving my bike rides.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah  Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great full-feature commuter bike. Enables great bike posture.
customer_reviews.text: The Bike is awesome. for me, the perfect blend of a 21-speed hi-quality, light bike in a commuter configuration. I'll admit I'm concerned about the spoke arrangement, but it doesn't seem to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyJoeS

customer_reviews.title: Heavy. Eye-catching. Fun.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my bike and had it professionally assembled, and am enjoying riding it around town. My average commute is 3-6 miles per day, and the only complaint I have is when there are items in the back basket (not included), it can definitely get a bit heavy. If you're looking for a bike to haul up and down stairs for apartment living, this may not be it for you. But, if you don't mind a solid bike and love a cruiser style, this is a great buy. I've had no problems since its assembly. For you accessory freaks out there, a note: it has no plugs for handlebar streamers.
customer_reviews.author: glitterdusted

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good :)
customer_reviews.text: Loving this bike. I'm almost 5'11" and it works great for me. I've been taking it out on the road, pulling a small dog trailer and it is working wonderfully. I only wish I would have spent a little extra money to have it assembled for me, but with a little patience, and some short test rides, it can be done on your own.
customer_reviews.author: VeggieNettie

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this bike - it's the right quality at ...
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this bike - it's the right quality at the right price. I've never put a bike together before, and I did get frustrated a few times trying to get this together; it too kme about 2 hours to finish, all said and done. Once it was together, I wasn't 100% happy with my work, so I paid the $40 at my local bike shop for a tune-up, and it has ridden perfectly ever since (with regular maintenance, filling the tires, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome CHIC bike !
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike and have gotten so many compliments! The seat and handlebars are extremely comfortable and pleasant. The color is BEAUTIFUL . It’s perfect for casual riding and even includes fenders and a rack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome find.
customer_reviews.text: I snagged this bike on sale and I must say I'm super pleased with it's performance. My son is super into biking and paid way more than I did for this model. He went over my bike very carefully and was extremely pleased with the build and quality. He couldn't find one single feature that was not shared between our bikes. To say he was green with envy over the savings is an understatement. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa C

customer_reviews.title: beautiful bike
customer_reviews.text: this rides so smoothly & was easy to put together. Only took us about an hour. I think the tire rims might be slightly warped but im not sure yet. I need to take it for a tune up. It is wonderfully light & easy to ride. shifts well right out of the box. Is a fairly tall bike for my size (5'4") but very adjustable. I really like the handlebars & the upright position of the seating. Regular bikes kill my neck. Arrived within 5 days of ordering!
customer_reviews.author: cutiebootiescookin

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: No issues with shipping; the bike was packaged well and arrived in a timely manner. Quality seems average (the fenders are plastic), and the assembly was fairly straight-forward although the instructions were little help. Just a note, the bike comes with a front wheel quick release, so don't try to remove the existing washers/nuts from the front wheel. Had trouble adjusting the front brake. If I had to do it over again, I would probably buy an assembled bike from Target.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Good value, works well once setup properly
customer_reviews.text: Bike is great. The value is there on a $300 bike. I use it to get around town and I love it. You will most likely have to adjust the brakes and gears to get them functioning just right. If you are not familiar with how to do this there are great videos on youtube or if you don't want the hassle there is always your local bike shop that won't mind doing it for a small fee. I do see how the rubber on the stem coming through the wheel can cause an inter tube failure at the worst time but that hasn't happened to me so far.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Looks and rides great
customer_reviews.text: Great Bike for the money! I love this bike. Brakes and gears are flawless so far after a few weeks of riding it about a dozen times. The seat is about 4 out of 5 stars. Adequately padded and easily adjusts with a lever. I am 6' about 245 lbs. so the shock absorber below the seat seems to compress most of the way when I sit on it. It is a comfortable and solid ride though. I had mine professionally assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Zanot

customer_reviews.title: Love it. First bicycle had missing components so could ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. First bicycle had missing components so could not be put together correctly. I contacted company and easily took back and send a new one that is perfect and looks good and love it. Good customer service. On a separate note: I bought the assembly service and the people who were supposed to assemble never showed up. I tried to reschedule it and they did not and after a few e-mails exchange they said that unilaterally cancelled the appointment and lied about the reason they cancelled saying that I had cancelled. In short, I was on my own to assemble bicycle which is not an easy project. Hire someone to do it if you can.
customer_reviews.author: MSL

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with everything you need
customer_reviews.text: This didn't come with everything you need to fully assembled a bike. I took it to a shop to help me assemble it. I'm truly disappointed about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Higgs Bosoms

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, easy to assemble, gives a nice ride.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Wasn't too hard to assemble, although finer adjustments may get complicated. I like the many gear settings, live in Austin TX where there are a lot of steep hills. The bike is comfortable, but if you are much below 6 feet tall this bike may be too high for you. I find the seat just a little bit too small and may get myself a larger more comfortable seat. All in all a very nice bike for the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. House

customer_reviews.title: Bad wheels, great bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my wife and the men's version for myself, after 6 months the bikes are great. The wheels on the other hand, crap. Bad spokes or bad design but either way a constant problem of broken spokes or wheels will not hold true. Had a local bike shop replace the factory wheels and we are much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Steele

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase.
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful, cost effective bike for my 13 year old young lady. It will definitely last her for many years. Easy to put together, good quality, seems durable, only thing that surprised me was that the fenders are plastic, looks like metal in pics. It took me less than an hour to put together, and I'm not a bike mechanic. The brakes needed minor adjusting, which would be completely normal, derailer worked perfectly. Overall a fantastic purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, except having a lot of trouble using ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, except having a lot of trouble using all the gears. Took it to a bike shop for tune-up after assembling- which was not very easy. The rear derailleur is still not right. But, the bike is very comfortable and a perfect size for me- 5'10". The handlebars are positioned for a comfortable long ride. The little carrying thing on the back is nice, too.
customer_reviews.author: Abby H

customer_reviews.title: Other than that aberration the bike is terrific and better than expected for the price paid
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it five stars, but a missing bolt that attaches the front of the rear fender to the pedal crank area allowed the fender to move and rub the rear tire. Called Schwinn customer service and they promptly sent the wrong size bolt. So at that point we came up with our own attaching solution. Other than that aberration the bike is terrific and better than expected for the price paid. It is truly a well thought out and well designed bike for use as an urban commuter. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Home shop guy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic...unbelievable!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a disappointment. Plastic fenders that are so thin they bend with the touch of a finger! Hopefully the rest of the bike is built better! I’ll add more once it’s put together. Box arrived smashed on one end.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Y.

customer_reviews.title: Issues changing velocities
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the noise and wsy changing the velocities. Some positions make noise and don't work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Medan

customer_reviews.title: Painful seat 😖
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful quality bike. Easy to assemble. Extremely, uncomfortable seat. Any one else have this problem? It physically hurts me to ride. My husband tried it out and has no problem but I am wondering if a wider saddle may be needed. I am 5’7”. Curvy but not obese or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bike!
customer_reviews.text: Great bikes (we also bought the female version). We have put on over 50 miles and they work great with minimal adjustments required. Takes some time to assemble as the instructions are generic for many models and poorly written. Plan to ditch the seat if you like comfort. We also put on new seat posts as the ones that come with it slip a bit too much. We are very happy with these bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great Commuter Bike
customer_reviews.text: Recently moved to Minneapolis and living in an urban area without owning a car is a cinch with this wonderful bike. I have had many commuter bikes in my life and I think this one is the best. I like sitting in an upright position (easy on the back)and the seat is wide and comfy. I am 5 feet 7 inches tall and this bike fits like a dream. It looks good and I get lots of compliments as I zip around the bike trails. Go ahead and spend the money to take it to a bike shop for assembly. This is a transportation investment type of bike and it is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia R.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE the bike!
customer_reviews.text: very light weight, considering i haven't been on a bike for like 10 + years, this one is pretty awesome to get back into game on!
customer_reviews.author: Madam Zu Zu

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike for daily commuting
customer_reviews.text: I had this bike now for over a year and have been using it almost every day summer and winter to go to work. A 15 mile round trip for over a year and it is running like a swiss watch with just a little maintenance once every 2 months or so. Using it almost daily for over a year I've probably put about 4000 miles on this bike and it's still a great ride.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: non standard size tube
customer_reviews.text: Got a flat. ordered and purchased 4 different tubes. None fit. Very very narrow with an extremely long stem. Ended up patching the tire. Still haven't located a tube that fits. Otherwise - it's an awesome bike.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Fun, exhilarating, good exercise!
customer_reviews.text: It’s just a bike for me. During the pandemic you need something to do. When my children were much younger it was Exhilarating to ride a bike with them. I loved riding bikes as a kid myself.
customer_reviews.author: Peggers

customer_reviews.title: Good bike, flawed rear wheel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike in 2011. I had repeated flat back tires and the inner tube even popped twice when the bike shop changed it. The ended up ordering a new tire which still didn't solve the problem. They contacted Schwinn and found there was something wrong with the wheel itself. Schwinn sent a new wheel, tire and innertube and paid the bike shop to install it. I do love the bike but it was frustrating (and expensive for the first 3 tire changes). It seems to be fine now. I was happy with Schwinn's response.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts that took several weeks to get from seller. Rode it once and gears not shifting properly. After spending $70 plus tax to have reputable.bike shop look over and basically adjust brakes. Gears still continue to not shift properly. Just took it for a ride after bike shop looked at it and when shifting from low to high gears it drops all the way back down to first gear.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M Diliberto

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: When I got this little bike it was just $179, so I thought I had little to lose. I ride it to work every day, about 15 miles a day, year-round, on a mostly level bike path. It's been fine. Wish it had a higher gear so I could go a bit faster... but for just relaxing and commuting to work, it does the job just fine. It's lasted 1.5 year so far, and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: T. D. Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for a big guy.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I initially had a bike sent that had a flaw. They immediately sent out a replacement and I've done quite a few rides on it. I have been able to make the adjustments I need and it shifts beautifully. The only reason I did not give it a 5 star rating is because they used the lowest end derailleurs and my confidence to the holding up is a little shaky.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Ray.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike is just great. Was a breeze to set up. I’m a larger guy 6’ 260lbs and I’m pretty comfortable on it longest ride I’ve done is only about 12 miles though. Also I’ve put about 200 miles on it and even though the Tubes had to be changed almost immediately (thorns on my bike path) everything else is holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: paid 179
customer_reviews.text: have it 3 years, it is what it is, at 179, it was a steal, at 300, not so sure, just starting to fall apart, maybe 1000 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: The pedal fell off
customer_reviews.text: The pedal fell off while we were out on a bike ride. After the third time we took it out. We’ve only had the bike for a week.
customer_reviews.author: monika Kobeszko

customer_reviews.title: nice bike
customer_reviews.text: I got this bike to alternate my running days with something less aggressive to my joints. I have gone out twice with this bike and I am very happy with it. It came in two boxes, since I have no experience putting bikes together I took it to the local bike shop. The guy wanted $70.00 to do it!, on top of that, he gave me a little speech about shopping locally, so i took my back home and i decided to do it myself. I am so glad I did! I was very easy, most parts were already put together. And I saved some cash.
customer_reviews.author: mike watanabe

customer_reviews.title: ... my 6 foot 4 boyfriend and this one is perfect! The frame is nice and large and so ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time finding a bike large enough for my 6 foot 4 boyfriend and this one is perfect! The frame is nice and large and so is the adjustable seat! It is also quite slick looking!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike
customer_reviews.text: I chose this bike very long time. I didn't want spend a lot of money and thought about good bike. And bought it. Now I use it more than 2 month and completely satisfied with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksei Voloshin

customer_reviews.title: ... a pair of this model bike and they are amazing. The 700cc tires makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I order a pair of this model bike and they are amazing. The 700cc tires makes all the difference. They are made of quality materials and ride great. My only con is we have to pump up the tires almost every week, but I have been told this is an issue with this type of tire.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived pretty much as expected so none of the packaging problems that other reviewers mentioned. Did have problems getting the front brakes aligned properly but fortunately had a neighbor help me. Can't imagine taking it to a bike shop and telling them that I bought this off of Amazon and need help putting it together. All in all a great value for the price but I still have to figure out the gears. The Schwinn book that came with it leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: TomE

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bike! I don't have time to ride it often, but I do bring it on vacation with me every year. The front tire is easy to detach and then I can fold down the seats in my sedan and it fits inside. It has survived garage living for about three years now without any rusting. I find it easy to adjust (I am 5'9") and easy to ride as a beginner. It was the best deal I could find as far as value and quality, and I am still happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I liked the bike so much this is my second bike. The first bike was stolen. This bike does require maintenance as parts do loosen up, especially when ridden off road. I ride the C&O canal in Maryland which is a hard pack trail. I always tighten up nuts before and after rides. After all the bike is sort of a cheapie. Nice ride, Gears aren't too bad. I would recommend to someone who rides occasionally and is prepared to do maintenance as needed.
customer_reviews.author: S. G. Coates

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable bike
customer_reviews.text: This came partially setup, which was helpful. It took about an hour for me to put the rest of it together. It needed some adjustments after riding it a few times, but it's great now. It's a sturdy bike. I hadn't been on a bike for over 10 years, and this was really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica by the Beach

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Bike!
customer_reviews.text: Sweet bike! I have nothing negative to say about it. Have put several hundred miles on it with nothing more to complain about than a couple of flat tires, and it's not their fault. Came out of the box with the gears already perfectly adjusted. That was nice. I removed the fenders, personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest H.

customer_reviews.title: Ladies bike
customer_reviews.text: I really really like this bike just one thing I would change on this bike. The gears to change require gripping and force, and an older rider like me has a little trouble with this. My husbands bike has a thumb gear changer- just click and I wish mine had this too. His is super easy and mine is a bitch.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon C.

product_meta.title: Schwinn Discover Hybrid Bike for Men and Women, 21 Speed, 28-Inch Wheels, Step-Through or Step-Over Frame, Multiple Colors
product_meta.description: Schwinn was established in 1895, by Ignaz Schwinn in Chicago, IL. Remembered for iconic bikes like the Phantom, the Varsity, the Stingray and the original Krate and Picker series of children's bikes, Schwinn has made it possible for riders of all ages to experience the thrill of riding a bicycle. Children and adults around the world trust the Schwinn name for quality and value. The joys of learning to ride for the first time, sharing an excursion with friends, proudly completing a new training regime or enjoying a local scenic route are all best enjoyed on a Schwinn.
feature_bullets: Schwinn suspension fork. Schwinn alloy crank, City rise adjustable stem with back sweep handlebar. All the biking comfort details
21-speed SRAM grip shifter and Shimano rear derailleur mean that pedaling up a hill is easier. Alloy twist shifter compatible 4 finger brake levers
"Promax alloy linear pull brakes; gear carrier. Adjust the angle (rise) of the alloy Ahead stem. Assembled Weight 35.5 pounds"
Swept-back upright handlebars, padded seat. The aluminum frame is lighter and yet durable, fenders keep dirt off the rider
Fenders keep dirt off the rider and Rear carrier for convenient city riding

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
